subject: Design
title: E-Waste: The Dark Side of Tech Design
description: A short lesson to help you apply E-Waste: The Dark Side of Tech Design.

hook.text: The world generates 50 million tons of e-waste per year. Only 20% is properly recycled.

buildup.text: Phones, laptops, and TVs contain gold, copper, and rare earths â€” valuable materials locked in discarded devices.

discovery.text: One ton of circuit boards contains 40-800 times more gold than one ton of gold ore.

twist.text: Most e-waste is shipped to developing countries where children dismantle it, inhaling toxic fumes.

climax.text: E-waste is a design failure. Products designed for disassembly and recovery could eliminate it.

punchline.text: We throw away more gold in phones each year than we mine from the earth.

quiz.question: What makes e-waste both a problem and an opportunity?
options: Discarded electronics contain valuable rare materials that could be recovered
